contraindications.pregnancy: ACE inhibitors and ARBs are contraindicated during pregnancy due to risk of fetal harm
contraindications.renal failure: Use diuretics with caution in severe renal impairment
contraindications.hyperkalemia: ACE inhibitors and potassium-sparing diuretics may increase potassium levels
contraindications.asthma: Beta-blockers may exacerbate bronchospasm in patients with asthma

contraindications.penicillin allergy: Avoid amoxicillin and amoxicillin-clavulanate in patients with penicillin allergy
contraindications.pregnancy: Doxycycline and fluoroquinolones should be avoided during pregnancy
contraindications.myasthenia gravis: Fluoroquinolones may exacerbate muscle weakness in myasthenia gravis
contraindications.QT prolongation: Macrolides and fluoroquinolones may prolong QT interval

contraindications.renal impairment: Metformin is contraindicated in severe renal impairment (eGFR <30 mL/min)
contraindications.heart failure: Thiazolidinediones may cause fluid retention and worsen heart failure
contraindications.diabetic ketoacidosis: SGLT2 inhibitors should not be used in patients with DKA
contraindications.pancreatitis: GLP-1 receptor agonists should be used with caution in patients with history of pancreatitis

contraindications.MAO inhibitor use: SSRIs should not be used within 14 days of MAO inhibitor use due to risk of serotonin syndrome
contraindications.seizure disorder: Bupropion lowers seizure threshold and should be used with caution in patients with seizure disorders
contraindications.liver disease: Dose adjustments may be needed for patients with hepatic impairment
contraindications.suicidal ideation: Increased monitoring required in adolescents and young adults due to increased risk of suicidal thoughts
